description:
Welcome to a world where magic reigns and monsters lurk behind every corner. Into his land of deadly dragons and menacing magicians comes our heroine -- Lina Inverse, a cute, fireball-throwing sorceress who steals from the wicked and gives to herself! Along with Gourry, a handsome but dumb-as-a-rock swordsman, Lina challenges the forces of not-so-goodness as she seeks truth, justice, fame and gold! Well, mostly fame and gold... Grab your pack and join the wackiest bunch of misfits ever to embark on a quest!

(Source: Software Sculptors)
synonyms: Un incantesimo dischiuso tra i petali del tempo per Rina

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Medieval
tags.description: Partially or completely set in the Middle Ages or a Middle Ages-inspired setting. Commonly features elements such as European castles and knights.

tags.name: Travel
tags.description: Centers around character(s) moving between places a significant distance apart.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Dragons
tags.description: Prominently features mythical reptiles which generally have wings and can breathe fire.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Disability
tags.description: A work that features one or more characters with a physical, mental, cognitive, or developmental condition that impairs, interferes with, or limits the person's ability to engage in certain tasks or actions.

tags.name: Chimera
tags.description: Features a beast made by combining animals, usually with humans.

node.description:
Gualtiero Cannarsi is an Italian dialogue writer and director of dubbing.
He works in the field of Japanese animation in which he has dealt with the adaptation of the TV series Neon Genesis Evangelion and the Studio Ghibli's movies. These adaptations have been at the center of numerous criticisms and controversies for the style used, defined as cumbersome and sometimes grammatically incorrect, and for the alteration of the meaning of the original lines.

He dubbed [Inuyasha](https://anilist.co/anime/249) for the first 26 episodes, then contractual questions forced dubbing staff of Dynamic Italia to change casting roles and give his one to [Francesco Pezzulli](https://anilist.co/staff/165553). He dubbed Kurz Weber in the first two seasons of Full Metal Panic!, but then again his role was left to [Francesco Pezzulli](https://anilist.co/staff/165553) because of contractual issues (that meanwhile denied him to dub Kaworu Nagisa in Evangelion: Death & Rebirth and The End of Evangelion, altough he dubbed him in Neon Genesis Evangelion).

A group of musicians. Noted for their work on the [Slayers](https://anilist.co/anime/534/) series with composer [Osamu Tezuka](https://anilist.co/staff/103866/).

- [Toshirou Yabuki](https://anilist.co/staff/221623/)
- [Tsutomu Oohira](https://anilist.co/staff/221555/)
- [Akimitsu Honma](https://anilist.co/staff/124717/)

Fujino Sadayoshi is a sound director working for Cruise. He has mostly worked on anime shows produced by Sunrise and Nippon Animation. He was married to actress and voice actress [Fujii Kayoko](https://anilist.co/staff/105105/Kayoko-Fujii).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/TkashiWatanabe)

Joined Top Craft as an animator while still attending university, switched his focus to directing in the late '80s.

Married to [Miyata Naomi](https://anilist.co/staff/220081/).

Studied music composition under the late [Takeo Watanabe](https://anilist.co/staff/106839/).

_Note: Not to be confused with the [famous mangaka](https://anilist.co/staff/96938/)._

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/角川歴彦)

The chief executive officer of Kadokawa. Son of Genyoshi Kadokawa, the founder of the company.

Kadokawa was arrested on September 14, 2022 on suspicion of bribing a former member of the Tokyo 2020 Summer Olympics organizing committee, which he denies. He resigned from the company after he was indicted on the charges in October.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/151679259) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/member.php?id=1304769)

A freelance designer. He hasn't been active as an animator in over a decade.
